TITLE.value: Revelation ER Model for Virtual Learning

Description.value: A high-level model describing entity relationships for  Moodle type Virtual Learning Environment

systems.Description: Stores information on system users (student, teacher, administrator) including authentication and profile details.
Represents an individual course offering with details such as name, summary, start date, and description.
Groups courses into hierarchical categories for easier navigation and organizational management.
Tracks a record linking a user to a course and the specific enrolment method used.
Defines a role (e.g., student, teacher, administrator) and its associated permissions within the system.
Specifies an assessment element for a course such as an assignment, quiz, or exam.
Records the grade awarded to a user for a specific assessment item.
Represents an assignment activity within a course, including submission details and deadlines.
Manages a quiz activity, including questions, attempts, and timing controls.
Supports a discussion forum activity with threads, posts, and replies.
A generic container for a course activity or resource. Each Module corresponds one-to-one with its specialized record (e.g., Assignment, Quiz, Forum, Video Lecture, Slide Deck, eLearning)
Holds a file or multimedia content uploaded by a user and associated with a course.
Stores a scheduled event, deadline, or notification within the system calendar.
Represents a repository of questions used in quizzes and assessments, including metadata and categorization.
Represents an achievement badge awarded to a user to recognize milestones or accomplishments.

interactions.Description: A course category groups multiple courses for organizational purposes. Conversely, each course is assigned to one category.
A course is composed of one or more course modules that represent activities and resources. Conversely, each course module is associated with exactly one course.
Each course has one or more grade items that define its assessments. Conversely, each grade item is linked to a specific course.
A grade item produces grades for enrolled users based on performance. Conversely, each grade record is associated with one grade item.
A user enrollment record links a user to the courses in which they are enrolled. Conversely, each enrollment record belongs to a specific user.
A course includes enrollment records that connect it to its participants. Conversely, each enrollment record corresponds to a single course.
Users can be assigned one or more roles that determine their permissions and access levels. Conversely, each role may be assigned to multiple users.
A course module may instantiate an assignment activity within the course. Conversely, each assignment instance is uniquely linked to a course module.
A course module may instantiate a quiz activity within the course. Conversely, each quiz instance is uniquely linked to a course module.
A course module may instantiate a forum activity for discussion. Conversely, each forum instance is uniquely linked to a course module.
A course module may include file attachments or resources used in the activity. Conversely, each file resource is associated with a specific course module.
A course schedules calendar events such as deadlines, sessions, or meetings. Conversely, each calendar event is linked to a specific course.
A quiz may draw questions from the question bank for its assessments. Conversely, questions in the question bank can be used in multiple quizzes.
Users can earn badges for achievements and milestones within the system. Conversely, each badge can be awarded to multiple users.
